Html:
Hi,

We are migrating our old WinForms smart client application to Prism/CAL. Since we start at now, can we expect the Prism 4 stable by early 2011?

We are going market by 2011 March.

 

Regards,

Krish

By "stable" I'm assuming you mean "Release to Web" (RTW or RTM).  This was originally announced for October 2010 but appears to have slipped a month.

On Monday one of the team members (http://twitter.com/kdawg02 ) indicated that the RTW release "to MSDN" would be happening on Wednesday (http://twitter.com/kdawg02/status/1879402786848768 )

Obviously, since I'm writing this on Thursday afternoon UK time this hasn't happened and nobody's indicated why, but hopefully it'll be here soon.  Certainly you should be fine for going to market by March 2011. In fact the code has been pretty stable through all the recent drops and was considered "code complete" a few weeks ago.
We pushed it to Msdn and are waiting for it to propagate.

>We pushed it to Msdn and are waiting for it to propagate

Any estimate for when the RTW code will be up here on CodePlex?
Day?  Two?  Tonight?

Thanks,
Vic

as seen on MS download:
Prism 4.0 - November 2010
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=3453ab2b-2067-41e4-b087-312d8385cf1b
